title: The Mag wants to know about your rides too!

posts.content: For those who like to show off why not send a bit of a write-up and a few digital pics to magazine@ssvc.org.uk - we want to know all these details and publish in paper form too...

Chris
Please can you help........................................... new to site and not very techno we have a new split screen 1967 bus called Rita and would like to insert some pics of her.
Regards
Grant

Hi
Having trouble also posting pics to website for ssvc mag

Ta

Ron smith
aircooledkonnection.com

Apologies for just noticing this post...

If you've got anything interesting for the mag the details are in my sig, we are always crying out for stuff.

Cheers

would love to post some piccies ,but my bus is covered in 1963 clothing logo'sthat were discovered when it was going to be painted ,so dont really think its up to it yet maybe when its completed this year cheers

Marvelwear wrote:would love to post some piccies ,but my bus is covered in 1963 clothing logo'sthat were discovered when it was going to be painted ,so dont really think its up to it yet maybe when its completed this year cheers]


If I found those logos on my bus I'd be chuffed to bits What a discovery! They are awesome

If you've got any more photos of them send them to me Marvel, love signwritten buses and be great to put them in the mag! They look very well done as well, quality

A lot of nice mangos on the road but think with those logos yours has just become my favourite

If you've got any more photos of them send them to me Marvel, love signwritten buses and be great to put them in the mag! They look very well done as well, quality

wow do you want to borrow some money!cheers for that ,Its hibernating still ,but will go down and turn him over before dubfreeze

Hi I can send you information on our van if you want to do a write up. Gul started in 1967 in the back of a splitty on fistral beach cornwall. the van is a 1960 double door walk through going back to the original sealing wax red. In brief I am the brand manager for Gul and have personally been attending vw shows for 14 years, setting up Gnarlyvw with burns59 in 1999 (now reborn in 2010!) this is not just another company doing a van to jump on the bandwagon, we have many enthusiasts here and this is a project based on passion. Gul as a company have owned every van model from splitscreen to T5 even an LT35! The employees also make up a good selection of personal air/watercooled VW's. We will be attending VW shows this year with our vans and trading products also..oh yes and we are members of the splitscreen van club.


Regards
Jake (smiler23)
proper cornish all hail gul...the best suit a man could get barrelled in.R.E.S.P.E.C.T.
I'll send you something for sure!
Drop me a pm on here, or you can find my contact details in the front of your Club Magazine

Mike,
as I said at VF, I should have an article for you in the next month or so on my DC and it's adventures.
When's the deadline for inclusion in the next issue?
Dave

Cheers Dave. Deadlines out of the window at the moment as our recent house move has distracted me and I've taken my eye off the ball. Latest print deadline wizzed past two weeks ago and I'm still way off finishing the mag! Should be hitting doormats in a couple of days, but it's still a good week off completion here, and then it'll take a while to print and distribute ... Hopefully I'll get it out of the door before the next issue is due out

Whenever you are ready. If you get something to me in a few days, It may make this mag, if not it'll go into the next one.

OK mate - I should have a CD with article and pics for you at Busfest if you and Suzie are going?
Good luck to all of you with the house move

Cheers,
Dave
